author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content:
Hi Team, I used the below options to start the geth client .. terminal total difficulty was set to 50000000000000000 as recommended but when I check the logs for geth, I see that it is using a different TTD and is not syncing beyond the block mentioned below. Is this expected? Any thoughts on what could be wrong here?


INFO [06-07|13:10:52.498] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=12,308,106 hash=a6fbe9..bdbf28 td=43,532,321,247,089,466 ttd=43,531,756,765,713,534

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Can you try to restart geth? There was an issue where the TTD override did not apply on empty dbs

author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content: Sure, may I get the command to stop it or can I go ahead and kill the process?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Crtl + c

author: mariohavel
content:
I am aiming for tomorrow afternoon, around 4PM Prague time. <@97774605351010304> 
I didn't hurry to mine all the time in case someone contributes with hashrate but with on demand rigs, we can mine it anytime we want üôÇ

author: m.kalinin
content: It is 2 hours before the target time, right?

author: undying1200
content: Do we have an official time in UTC for testnet merge?

author: mariohavel
content: I am aiming for 2PM UTC tomorrow. Just deployed more miners to make it easier. Let me know if I should push more metrics to bordel.wtf

author: cheerful_piglet_95568
content: Restarted it and now seeing a flood of these messages.. Is that expected ?

author: claravanstaden
content: Is it possible to run a private beacon chain network, similarly to how you can run a private execution layer network using geth `networkid=15`?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Your node is syncing up while creating the snapshot, so yeah it is expected (not really great I know)

author: mariohavel
content: Btw if there is anybody who wants to contribute by mining on Ropsten, you can connect to our pool at `stratum1+tcp://34.253.214.146:4073`

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: yes you can do that (its what we do for the shadow forks)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Setting it up might not be as easy as setting up a private network with geth

author: claravanstaden
content: Thanks Marius! I think I'm going to try it out, Lodestar seems geared for it so going to try using their client first. https://chainsafe.github.io/lodestar/usage/local/

author: mrabino1
content: quick question.. after ropsten is the targeted sequence to have goerli go next or sepolia ? thx

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Goerli then sepolia, but it's not really fixed, if there's good arguments for having sepolia earlier, we can change that

author: wackerow
content:
Hey folks, have a PR up for some updates to the Staking Launchpad, related to preparing stakers for The Merge. 
GitHub PR: <https://github.com/ethereum/staking-launchpad/pull/493>
Merge Readiness Checklist preview link: <https://deploy-preview-493--serene-carson-3331d5.netlify.app/en/merge-readiness>
Any eyes/feedback on this would be much appreciated, as we want to make sure we're providing the most accurate information we can to stakers. üôè  Thanks in advance!

author: kommstar
content: <@397809066115727383> maybe there should be some sort of progress meter to indicate how far along we are (checkboxes for each testnet we have merged, and all the testnets still to be merged, perhaps tenative dates) so the timeline for merging is more explicit.
